Doc: A fixing region in which the payoff varies linearly with the fixing value.

Source.Contents:
/#
   A fixing region in which the payoff varies linearly with the fixing value.
 #/
record FpML5.recordkeeping.FxAccrualLinearPayoffRegion {
  # Indicates the first direction of who pays and receives a specific currency without specifying the amount.
  exchangedCurrency1 : FpML5.recordkeeping.FxExchangedCurrency

  # Indicates the second direction of who pays and receives a specific currency without specifying the amount.
  exchangedCurrency2 : FpML5.recordkeeping.FxExchangedCurrency

  # The rate of exchange between the two currencies.
  strike : FpML5.recordkeeping.FxForwardStrikePrice

  # The opposite currency amount. The counterCurrencyAmount element is only optional if averageStrike component is present or if the accrualRegion specifies the amount of counterCurrencyAmount to accrue, in all other cases this element must be populated.
  counterCurrencyAmount : FpML5.recordkeeping.NonNegativeAmountSchedule?

  # Average Strike Forward: means the average of the Reference Spot Rate on each Business Day from and including the Calculation Start Date up to and including the Calculation End Date rounded to the precision decimal places.
  averageStrike : FpML5.recordkeeping.FxAverageStrike

  # Defines the upper bound of a payoff region.
  upperBound : FpML5.recordkeeping.FxAccrualRegionUpperBound?

  # Defines the lower bound of a payoff region.
  lowerBound : FpML5.recordkeeping.FxAccrualRegionLowerBound

  # These structures define a leverage multiplier to the payoff amounts at settlement points.
  leverage : FpML5.recordkeeping.FxAccrualLeverage?

  # The amount of gain on the client upside or firm upside is limited. If spot settles above the cap, or below the floor, the payout is adjusted to limit the gain. The adjustment may be made by varying the strike, or by maintaining the strike, but varying the payout notionals.
  payoffCap : FpML5.recordkeeping.FxPayoffCap?

  id : string?

}

exchangedCurrency1.Doc: Indicates the first direction of who pays and receives a specific currency without specifying the amount.
exchangedCurrency1.Name: exchangedCurrency1

exchangedCurrency2.Doc: Indicates the second direction of who pays and receives a specific currency without specifying the amount.
exchangedCurrency2.Name: exchangedCurrency2

strike.Doc: The rate of exchange between the two currencies.
strike.Name: strike

counterCurrencyAmount.Doc: The opposite currency amount. The counterCurrencyAmount element is only optional if averageStrike component is present or if the accrualRegion specifies the amount of counterCurrencyAmount to accrue, in all other cases this element must be populated.
counterCurrencyAmount.Name: counterCurrencyAmount

averageStrike.Doc: Average Strike Forward: means the average of the Reference Spot Rate on each Business Day from and including the Calculation Start Date up to and including the Calculation End Date rounded to the precision decimal places.
averageStrike.Name: averageStrike

upperBound.Doc: Defines the upper bound of a payoff region.
upperBound.Name: upperBound

lowerBound.Doc: Defines the lower bound of a payoff region.
lowerBound.Name: lowerBound

leverage.Doc: These structures define a leverage multiplier to the payoff amounts at settlement points.
leverage.Name: leverage

payoffCap.Doc: The amount of gain on the client upside or firm upside is limited. If spot settles above the cap, or below the floor, the payout is adjusted to limit the gain. The adjustment may be made by varying the strike, or by maintaining the strike, but varying the payout notionals.
payoffCap.Name: payoffCap
